content: Layout customization is done within the `heroui` plugin in your `tailwind.config.js`. You can define a common `layout` object for all themes, or specify a different `layout` object inside each theme (e.g., for light and dark modes).
HeroUI provides default layout tokens for consistent spacing and sizing. These include `dividerWeight`, `disabledOpacity`, `fontSize`, `lineHeight`, `radius`, and `borderWidth`.
Some layout options, like `hoverOpacity` and `boxShadow`, are often defined per-theme to adapt to different color schemes (e.g., light vs. dark).
HeroUI automatically creates CSS variables for each layout token (e.g., `--heroui-radius-small`). The prefix (`heroui` by default) can be changed in the plugin options.
